recipe.name: Meatloaf Cupcakes With Mashed Potato
recipe.description: Everything tastes better in miniature form! These Meatloaf Cupcakes are made extra irresistible by piling on mashed potato. These freeze very well. They are also great for hiding vegetables. I only added grated carrot, but you can mix in whatever vegetables you want. Finely chopped spinach or cabbage would blend in well, as would grated zucchini.

itemListElement.text: Spray 8 holes of a muffin tin.
itemListElement.name: Spray 8 holes of a muffin tin.

itemListElement.text: Grate the onion and carrot straight into a large bowl.
itemListElement.name: Grate the onion and carrot straight into a large bowl.

itemListElement.text: Add remaining meatloaf ingredients and use your hands to mix and combine well.
itemListElement.name: Add remaining meatloaf ingredients and use your hands to mix and combine well.

itemListElement.text: Scoop up 1/2 cup of mince and use your hands to form a rough ball shape. Press into the muffin tin. The surface should be a slight dome shape.
itemListElement.name: Scoop up 1/2 cup of mince and use your hands to form a rough ball shape. Press into the muffin tin. The surface should be a slight dome shape.

itemListElement.text: Repeat with remaining mince. It should make about 8.
itemListElement.name: Repeat with remaining mince. It should make about 8.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 20 - 25 minutes until browned on top. Remove from oven.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 20 - 25 minutes until browned on top. Remove from oven.

itemListElement.text: Peel and dice the potato. Steam or boil until soft but not waterlogged.
itemListElement.name: Peel and dice the potato. Steam or boil until soft but not waterlogged.

itemListElement.text: Drain, then add butter and 1/2 cup of milk. Mash using a potato masher until smooth or to your liking. Add extra milk if you need it. The mash needs to be creamy but stiff enough to hold its shape when piped or piled onto the Meatloaf Cupcakes.
itemListElement.name: Drain, then add butter and 1/2 cup of milk. Mash using a potato masher until smooth or to your liking. Add extra milk if you need it. The mash needs to be creamy but stiff enough to hold its shape when piped or piled onto the Meatloaf Cupcakes.

itemListElement.text: Smear a dollop of tomato ketchup on the Meatloaf Cupcakes.
itemListElement.name: Smear a dollop of tomato ketchup on the Meatloaf Cupcakes.

itemListElement.text: Top with mashed potato, either by piping it or just dolloping it on with a spoon.
itemListElement.name: Top with mashed potato, either by piping it or just dolloping it on with a spoon.

itemListElement.text: Serve with a sprinkle of parsley, if using.
itemListElement.name: Serve with a sprinkle of parsley, if using.

review.reviewBody: I thought the kids might like this after reading the reviews - and turns out they loved it even more than we did! Such a hit, will be making again!
Making this for the second time in two weeks. Huge hit with my family. So delicious and easy!

These were AWESOME!!!
I didn't have any Panco so I substituted crushed Ritz crackers and a handful of tomato basil Wheat Thins...My family LOVED it.ðŸ’šThank you
Made these yesterday. I had mini loaf shaped muffin tray so 1) super cute and 2) cold meat loaf easy to slice for a sandwich. I had lamb mince and used a leek rather than an onion and its delicious.

They took a bit longer to get to temp than what was suggested but they were worth the wait.  I grew up with boring, dry meatloaf but this was so flavorful and moist.  I canâ€™t say I dislike meatloaf anymore.  Kids can help with the prep too, shredding carrots and measuring herbs and spices.  Bookmarked for future use!

I made these tonight for my family of 6 and OMG! They were a HUGE hit! My toddler even loved them.
I did make a couple adjustments by using minced garlic instead of garlic powder then adding a little Worcestershire Sauce and Dijon Mustard to the meatloaf mixture for a kick. I used heavy cream in place of the milk in the potatoes and added a little roasted garlic.
I also made my own sauce instead of using just ketchup but, 10/10 definitely recommend!!! The grated carrots were a great touch!
Thank you for sharing! Saving this one in the book!!!
How long would you bake the meatloaf for mini cupcakes?  My son will absolutely love these, I'm making them for his birthday.
Fast cooking, and good for fewer to feed.

Made this with ground turkey, added a tad of Worcestershire sauce and omitted carrots - we were out.  To make the entire cooking session faster I used  microwave mashed potatoes.  Served with a side of broccolini and it was amazing!  Will be made many many more times.  Thank you!
These are wonderful! My picky seven year old said she loves them more than bacon!

Thanks Nagi for such a delicious and quick alternative to traditional meatloaf! I made it for the first time and it was a hit!

I had to modify due to dietary issues and it still came out great!
I am obsessed with this recipe! I made it for my family last night and it was a huge hit. Such a unique meal. Will definitely be making again. Thank you!
Made this and it came out awesome!! Just didnâ€™t add carrots because I ran out. Also, I minced some garlic in there. So good!
